net.nicholaswilliams.java.licensing.immutable
Class ImmutableArrayList<E>

java.lang.Object
  net.nicholaswilliams.java.licensing.immutable.ImmutableAbstractCollection<E>
      net.nicholaswilliams.java.licensing.immutable.ImmutableArrayList<E>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<E>, Collection<E>, List<E>, Immutable
public final class ImmutableArrayList<E>
extends ImmutableAbstractCollection<E>
implements List<E>, Serializable, Cloneable

Wraps a list such that it cannot be modified. There is some overhead associated with this due to verification of hash codes on every call to prevent tampering with via reflection, but this is well worth it if your goal is security and you truly need an unmodifiable list.

Since:
1.0.0
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Nick Williams
See Also:
Serialized Form
